titleStmt.title: To the VVor∣shipfull, Master Richard Trist, of Maidford in Northamptonsh.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the VVor∣shipfull, Master Richard Trist, of Maidford in Northamptonsh.

monogr.title: The cleansing of the ten lepers, or, Briefe notes on Luke 17, vers. 14, 15, 16, 17, 18 by Mathevv Caylie minister of Gods Word at Maidford in Northamptonsh
monogr.author: Caylie, Mathew

div.head: To the VVorshipfull, Master Richard Trist, of Maidford in Northamptonsh.
div.p:
WOrthy Sir, (Not to prefixe a tedious Epistle, before so small a Treatise) hauing a resolution for the publication hereof, (for reasons knowne to my selfe, and perhaps, not vnknowne to some that know mee) I make bold (I hope, not too bold) to present the same vnto you, to testifie my respect of you.
Your Acceptance, Perusall, Patronage, are the onely things I desire; though I cannot say, as the Iewes concerning the Centurion in the Gospel, thatLuk. 7. 4. either it, or my selfe, is worthy for whom you should doe this. The God of heauen, the giuer of all good blessings, blesse you, & yours, prosper, and preserue you blamelesse vnto the comming of our Lord Iesus Christ.

closer.signed: A Petitioner for you, vnto the throne of grace, MATH, CAYLIE.
